intro: Taraxacum ohwianum, commonly known as the Ohwia dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Japan and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and heart-shaped basal leaves. The plant produces a distinctive seed head composed of numerous parachute-like seeds, which are dispersed by the wind. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in disturbed soils or open areas. Botanically, it is notable for its robust root system and its role in supporting local pollinators.
